content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Define the start and end identifiers for the code blocks
    start_code_block = "```julia"
    end_code_block = "```"

    # Initialize a variable to hold all the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Track whether currently inside a code block
    in_code_block = false

    # Split the markdown document into lines for processing
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Iterate through each line in the markdown document
    for line in lines
        # If the line indicates the start of a new Julia code block,
        # set the flag to true
        if line == start_code_block
            in_code_block = true
            continue  # Skip adding the start indicator to the extracted code
        end

        # If the line indicates the end of a Julia code block,
        # set the flag to false
        if line == end_code_block
            in_code_block = false
            continue  # Skip adding the end indicator to the extracted code
        end

        # If currently inside a code block, add the line to the extracted code
        # Followed by a newline character to maintain formatting
        if in_code_block
            extracted_code *= line * "\n"
        end
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```
